Posts.Content: I had some some small pea size lumps around my nipples that hurt a lot to touch when they first appeared but the lumps now have completely gone. I'm not saying that you should take this lightly you do need to be vigilant, but not all lumps turn out to be harmful here's the link to my original thread: [url]http://www.healthboards.com/boards/showthread.php?t=410332[/url]
Posts.Title: Small firm lump - 18 yr old male

Posts.Content: Thanks ozybug for the quick reply. Unless the lump gets bigger then the Doc will see me after a nice lazy holiday... let you know how things develop or hopefully- not develop
Posts.Title: Male with lumps...

Posts.Content: Thanks for the advice guys n gals. Just an update, back from my enjoyable family holiday and the lump in my right breast has shrunk to almost nothing, the lump on my left breast has gone. I havn't as yet gone to the docs it seems that the right hand lump is following the history of my left one, hopefully just blocked glands
Posts.Title: Male with lumps...

Posts.Content: Hi I realise that lumps in the breast area is mostly a female problem but I have a problem and hope you can help... A few weeks ago my nipples and the surrounding area became very sore followed not soon later by a lump approx 5mm across on the edge of the nipple area. That went down and the soreness went after a couple of weeks but I have had another develop on the other nipple. About the same size as the other and it doesn't move, it's been there for a couple of weeks now.. I will go and see a doctor if it's still there in 2 weeks. Last year I had a kidney transplant so am on immunosuppressant drugs. The family had a miserable time last year and we are to go on a long overdue holiday next week so don't want to spoil anything for my family, they deserve that holiday..
Posts.Title: Male with lumps...
